author: .fjl
content: But getCode takes a block parameter like all other state access. So providing a value for the block should give you an up-to-date value. If it is cached incorrectly, it's a bug.

author: antonydenyer
content:
At the node level it's probably fine, but some different RPCs cache get code differently. No doubt for historical reasons. The other issue is if your trying to build a history of delegations and their validity you're going to need an archive node (either using get code or transaction count).

Jumping through hoops to get the status of something that potentially changes the state of something just feels janky. 

The status/validity should be on the transaction at the block and receipt level imo
